1.brief: properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
David, the youngest son of Jesse
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to lack; by implication, to fail, want, lessen

2.brief: to crouch (on all four legs folded, like a recumbent animal); be implication, to recline, repose, brood, lurk, imbed
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
repose or (adverbially) peacefully; figuratively, consolation (specifically, matrimony); hence (concretely) an abode
properly, to run with asparkle, i.e. flow; hence (transitively), to conduct, and (by inference) to protect, sustain

3.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

4.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
a gorge (from its lofty sides; hence, narrow, but not a gully or winter-torrent)
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
support (abstractly), i.e. (figuratively) sustenance or (concretely) a walking-stick
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)

5.brief: to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a table (as spread out); by implication, a meal
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive
to be fat; transitively, to fatten (or regard as fat); specifically to anoint; figuratively, to satisfy;  to remove (fat) ashes (of sacrifices)
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
a cup (as a container), often figuratively, a lot (as if a potion); also some unclean bird, probably an owl (perhaps from the cup-like cavity of its eye)

6.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
